intro: Nanocnide zhejiangensis, commonly known as the Zhejiang nanocnide, is a rare and endemic plant species native to China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its fruits are small berries that turn red when mature, attracting various bird species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native region.
